alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 2:56PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Northern Albany county and the lower elevations of Carbon county. This includes the city of Rawlins. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills Wednesday and Thursday as low as 35 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
